channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Donald Trump just straight-up admitted he is working to meddle in the election
'Um, wow': CNN anchor stunned by Trump's briefing remarks
item.description: CNN's John Berman and Kaitlan Collins discuss President Trump repeating the same exact talking points during his coronavirus briefings.

item.title: 'No way in hell': US rejects Russia offers to help with Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Russian officials in Moscow tell CNN they have offered "unprecedented cooperation" with Operation Warp Speed (OWS), the US multi-agency body set up to accelerate access to effective Covid-19 vaccines and treatments.

item.title: New Zealand's fresh outbreak is a dramatic turn of events
'Bottom line is, I'm not happy with how this is going,' Fauci says
Kamala Harris throws Trump off balance
US calls to ease shower rules after Trump complains about his hair
item.description: The US Department of Energy released a proposal to roll back water efficiency standards for showerheads following President Donald Trump's comments that he was unable to wash his "beautiful hair properly." CNN's Bill Weir has more.

item.title: Pentagon to launch task force to investigate UFO sightings
item.description: The Pentagon is forming a new task force to investigate UFOs that have been observed by US military aircraft, according to two defense officials.

item.title: WWII hero honored, 78 years after going down guns blazing with his ship
item.description: His shipmates said after the battle that they could see the bullets from the teenager's machine gun whizzing up through the water as he went down with his ship, firing to the last.

item.title: Kushner claims Kanye West meeting was a 'policy' talk
item.description: White House senior adviser Jared Kushner confirmed on Thursday that he had a "friendly discussion" about policy with Kanye West in Colorado, saying the conversation wasn't necessarily focused on the rapper's presidential campaign.

item.title: Is Covid-19 making airplane passengers more unruly?
Why you shouldn't be worried about getting coronavirus from food
Israel and the UAE have established 'full normalization of relations,' Trump says
Hear from Kamala Harris' uncle in Delhi on her heritage
item.description: Joe Biden the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee named Kamala Harris as his vice presidential pick, making the California senator the first Black and South Asian American woman to run on a major political party's presidential ticket. Harris was raised by her Indian mother. CNN's Vedika Sud speaks to her extended family in India on how her Indian roots shaped her political views.

item.title: Melania Trump plots convention speech that hopes to avoid past missteps
item.description: First lady Melania Trump's Rose Garden makeover is coming just in time.

item.title: How Trump's war on WeChat could upend the global tech industry
DOJ accuses Yale of discriminating against Asian American and White applicants
item.description: The Justice Department accused Yale University of discriminating against Asian American and White applicants in its undergraduate admissions process.

item.title: Keilar: Dr. Atlas wouldn't know science if it kicked him in the Atlas
item.description: Months into the coronavirus pandemic, President Donald Trump announced Dr. Scott Atlas as a medical adviser for the White House coronavirus task force. CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down Dr. Atlas's controversial stance on Covid-19.

item.title: Power lifter fractures both knees while attempting to squat nearly 900 pounds
item.description: A Russian power lifter broke both his knees while trying to lift nearly 900 pounds.

item.title: Fortnite maker sues Apple over removal from App Store
item.description: The maker of Fortnite is suing Apple after Apple blocked the wildly popular online video game with hundreds of millions of registered players from its app store Thursday.

item.title: Slimmed-down UK PM wants Brits to count their calories. Experts say that's a bad idea
item.description: Boris Johnson's latest strategy to fight coronavirus aims to make Britain healthier -- but campaigners are worried about the impact the policy will have on people living with eating disorders.

item.title: Trump's quest for 'perfect' hair starts with the shower
item.description: Last week, the President of the United States again lamented one of his most commonly referenced beefs.

item.title: This country is using robots to help monitor coronavirus patients
item.description: Rwanda is using medical robots to help monitor coronavirus patients. CNN's Richard Quest speaks to Rwandan official Paula Ingabire about this technology.

item.title: 30 women have come forward with groping claims against Cuba Gooding Jr.
item.description: Manhattan prosecutors in Cuba Gooding Jr.'s groping case said in court Thursday that more women have come forward with accusations of unwanted touching by the Oscar-winning actor, bringing the total number of women to come forward to 30.

item.title: The architecture and culture that Beirut stands to lose after the devastating blast
item.description: At the moment that one of the largest non-nuclear explosions in history blasted outwards from Beirut's port and swept across the city, Zeina Arida, the director of Sursock Museum, was standing outside her office with two colleagues. The force of the explosion, less than a mile away, threw them into the museum's stairwell, as all around them windows shattered and glass and debris rained down. "We have escaped by a miracle," Arida said over the phone three days later. "The museum is blown away, very simply... There is no door, no window, no glass left in the building."

item.title: Protesters in Bolivia cry out as country is hit by dual pandemics
item.description: Bolivia's presidential elections were postponed once again, leading to protests and unrest. This comes as the South American country struggles to contain the rapid spread of Covid-19. CNN's Stefano Pozzebon reports.

item.title: Tongue-eating parasite found in the mouth of a fish
item.description: In the course of studying wrasse skulls, an evolutionary biologist found a parasite hiding inside a fish's mouth. And not only had the louse eaten the fish's tongue -- it effectively replaced it.

item.title: The reason we're shooting laser beams between Earth and the moon
item.description: For the first time ever, scientists received a signal after sending laser beams from Earth to a reflector on NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter around the moon.

item.title: Meet the man who's worried when sharks DON'T show up
item.description: Let's say you're ready to ditch your ho-hum job and swap it out for a not-so-typical, always dangerous, adrenaline-pumping kind of career.

item.title: Michelle Obama speaks out about women's health
item.description: HLN's Melissa Knowles talks about Michelle Obama opening up in her latest podcast about women's health and the stigmas associated with speaking about it.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend expecting third child
item.description: Things are going to get even more "Wild" in Chrissy Teigen and John Legend's home.

item.title: Why Meghan Markle wanted to interview The 19th*'s Emily Ramshaw
item.description: One of Meghan Markle's first public appearances since stepping back from the British royal family in January will be as an interviewer.

item.title: Japan's first-ever hotel in a wooden castle breathes new life into fading rural town
item.description: A new Japanese hotel is offering travelers a first-of-its-kind experience -- to live like a medieval lord in a real castle keep.

item.title: Russell Crowe contributes to GoFundMe for Beirut restaurant beloved by Anthony Bourdain
item.description: The initial GoFundMe goal for Beirut restaurant Le Chef was set at an attainable $13,000.

item.title: Socially distanced rock concert puts fans in metal boxes
item.description: When the coronavirus pandemic emerged, the music and hospitality industry took a beating. Concerts and events were canceled all over the world as countries imposed lockdown restrictions and stay-at-home orders to curb the spread of the virus.

item.title: TV star shows off his pandemic look
item.description: "The Price Is Right" host Drew Carey posted a picture on his Instagram page showing off his new beard.

item.title: Climate change spelled doom for woolly rhinos 14,000 years ago, study says
item.description: Woolly rhinos went extinct at the end of the last ice age in Siberia about 14,000 years ago, and now ancient DNA is helping to shed light on what really happened to them and other large mammals.

item.title: 'Extinct' large blue butterfly successfully reintroduced to UK
item.description: Finally, some good news! Conservationists have successfully reintroduced previously extinct large blue butterflies to the UK, with the creatures populating parts of the country for the first time in 150 years.

item.title: Late-night host has parents review racy new Cardi B video
item.description: The parents of late-night host James Corden joined "The Late Late Show" to offer their review of Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion's new music video for their hit song "WAP."

item.title: 'George Eliot' among 25 female writers being republished using their real names
item.description: Victorian-era writer Mary Ann Evans is often heralded as the literary force behind one of Britain's greatest ever novels, "Middlemarch." But for much of her life, and even today, she is better known by her male pseudonym, George Eliot, which she adopted to conceal her gender at a time when women were excluded from intellectual circles.

item.title: More women on motorcycles and scooters are hitting the roads in Egypt
item.description: On the congested streets of Cairo, Egypt's capital city, rider Dina Wassef is mounting a motorcycle, presenting a rare sight.

item.title: Glenn Robinson III on life inside the NBA 'bubble' and fighting for social justice
item.description: For NBA players, life in the "bubble" in Orlando, Florida, isn't easy. You're away from your family and stuck in a hotel room with limited interaction outside of your team.

item.title: Heralded as leader on squashing Covid-19, fresh outbreak of community transmissions forces new restrictions
item.description: LIVE: 'Bottom line is, I'm not pleased with how things are going,' Fauci says CDC issues dire Covid-19 warning

item.title: The CDC issues a dire warning for the fall
item.description: A top federal health official is issuing a dire warning: Follow recommended coronavirus measures or risk having the worst fall in US public health history.

item.title: GOP governor compares kids going back to school to killing bin Laden
item.description: The first rule of politics has long been to never, ever compare anything to Nazi Germany. The murder of 6 million Jews defies comparison. The second rule of politics -- or maybe just an addendum to the first rule -- should be: Never compare anything to the mission that led to the death of Osama bin Laden.

item.title: Young people driving second, less-deadly surge in Europe
item.description: Europe is giving the world a glimpse at what happens when the coronavirus epidemic is brought under control and the economy reopens: the virus bounces back.

item.title: Face mask fights erupt on packed airplanes
item.description: Stephanie Scherrer was settling in for her two-hour Southwest Airlines flight from Denver, Colorado to her home in Los Angeles, California. Her face covering was on, her hand sanitizer was ready, she'd wiped down the seats and her two kids were also masked up.

item.title: Donald Trump just straight-up admitted he is working to meddle in the election
item.description: Judge orders Trump campaign to produce evidence of voter fraud Analysis: Most shocking lines from Trump's Fox Business interview Analysis: This is Biden's secret weapon

item.title: Harris throws Trump off balance
item.description: Everyone knew that Sen. Kamala Harris was a frontrunner to get the nod as Joe Biden's running mate; everyone, it seems, except President Donald Trump and his brain trust of loyalists and paid staffers.

item.title: Israel and the UAE will establish 'full normalization of relations,' Trump says
